job_title: Occupational Therapist in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great place to learn and develop and good support from my coworkers
cons: Had to work weekends once a month

job_title: Phelbotomist in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Coworkers are team players and help each other out.
cons: Pay is ridiculously low for the job, prior experience is not valued and the hours and days off are inconsistent.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Fort Oglethorpe, GA
pros: Great staff, ED, and pay comparable to other hospital in the area.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Memphis, TN
pros: Good environment and friendly staff
cons: Pt ratio is hood with support from staff

review_title: It's not terrible, I feel like they do try, and I fear things are worse at other hospitals in our area
job_title: Registered Nurse in Chattanooga, TN
pros: They are trying to become a magnet hospital which if they get, nurses will have a greater voice! We do get minimal pay raises....my personal manager is good- work around school schedule well- people overall seem to like this faith based hospital and it has a caring atmosphere
cons: Opportunities to advance are for bachelor degree nurses- not all mgmt is good, I'm just lucky. Overworked and underpaid. Tennessee nurses need a union so we can have proper representation. Keep adding more and more for one RN to do on the job. Poor documentation system, for crying out loud spend some of your millions on a up to date documentation system, we need off this DOS system!!!! Not putting money where it's needed, but instead into more buildings (show) and have to park a mile away, in a dangerous area! Fine you $100 for parking anywhere else!!! They need a parking garage that employees can park in, invest money into that!!!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Maryville, TN
pros: Everyone worked as a team.
cons: It was a lot of patients at a time.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Cleveland, TN
pros: Good place to work. Supportive management.
cons: No cons for this employer.

review_title: They were a nice place to work but the pay was not up to current pay scale
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chattanooga, TN
pros: They never lay off but they cut hours down so you will always have work. They have a very strict dress code but you never see patients. They have a few good team leaders but most of the managers are not so great. They used to have incentives but they keep cutting them down.
cons: You will always will have work, they are mostly women and work is massive, they are on a limit to get work done

review_title: Management and staff are liars and backstabbers.
job_title: CNA in Chattanooga, TN
pros: New north tower to work in.
cons: Employees pretend to be your friend but will back stab you in a heartbeat. HR doesn't investigate matters they only take one persons side of the story (whoever complains first). The managers are two faced and the turnover is very high. Complaining to the CEO or Vice president does nothing because all they care about is profit.  The company spouts compassion and excellence but it fails to show their employees these core values. It's sad that an organization that professes the teachings of Jesus Christ are far far from them, instead they deceive and destroy like their adversary Satan.

review_title: Great for patients, not so much for employees
job_title: Registered Nurse in Chattanooga, TN
pros: Ample opportunities for overtime, strong commitment to the patient and their wellbeing.
cons: The unit nurses tend to be "clique-y" which is also noted by the physicians to be detrimental to care. While the hospital strives to excel in patient care, they fail to excel in employee retention and care. They do not follow their own mission statement when it comes to their employees. They do not value a job well done or loyalty.

job_title: Outpatient Pharmacy Technician in Melrose Park, IL
pros: they have good communication skills which is really hard to find in a company
cons: there are no cons from me

job_title: PTA Assistant in Maywood, IL
pros: Friendly staff, well organized facility
cons: Corporate model with limited patient one on one time

job_title: Registered Nurse in Melrose Park, IL
pros: self scheduling, team work environment
cons: managers are way too new, corrupt administrators are all friends and no complaints get anywhere, peri-op educator is nowhere to be found on the surgical units FULL of new grads struggling to stay afloat. managers get snippy and cant take suggestions from staff without getting hostile. entire 2nd floor needs a serious attitude change. huge mass exodus of nurses within a year. they lie about oncall requirements to get workers then deny everything told during hiring process. HR is no help they can’t change the mind of leadership. some nurses on call choose to sleep in undesignated patient rooms.

pros: Flexibility, Clean Hospital, Free parking, pick up opportunities
cons: Short staffed (often 1 pct per unit for nights) Frequent online training and workshops

job_title: Dietary Aide in Melrose Park, IL
pros: wonderful coworkers good holiday pays

job_title: Surgical orderly in Kenosha, WI

job_title: Registered Nurse in Melrose Park, IL
pros: Good teamwork on my unit. Various types of patient conditions which is great for new grads who want to learn all about nursing.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Melrose Park, IL
pros:
+ Amazing critical care team 
+ Very responsive management 
+ Good support in transitioning as a new nurse with a 4 month orientation period
+Able to create our own schedules
cons:
+ Certain management positions were held by individuals with ineffective leadership skills
+ No salary transparency at the time
+ Was transitioning into a new structure at the time because the hospital was merging with a larger health system and that transition was pretty rocky and unclear.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Melrose Park, IL
pros: I get to make my own schedule. The Float Pool Manager is considerate and understanding.
cons: PCA's are given too many patients, and most times one PCA ( Patient Care Technician ) works a unit with 20 patients.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Melrose Park, IL
pros: 8 hr shift. Can’t find any more pros.
cons: Don’t work on 5 cardiac. The manager puts employees against each other and encourages stabbing.  RUN.  CNAs don’t stick around.  Heavy workload.  20 to 24 to one aid.  The manager refused help to save on her budget.

job_title: Outpatient Nurse in Melrose Park, IL

cons: Small community hospital does not have many recourses.

review_title: Worst job I have ever had.
